supportive_phrases: I understand that must be difficult for you.
Thank you for sharing that with me.
It sounds like you're going through a really tough time.
Your feelings are completely valid and understandable.
I'm here to listen and support you through this.
It takes courage to reach out when you're struggling.
You're not alone in feeling this way.
I can hear how much pain you're in right now.
That sounds incredibly challenging to deal with.
I appreciate you trusting me with these feelings.
follow_up_questions: How long have you been feeling this way?
What do you think might have contributed to these feelings?
Have you been able to talk to anyone else about this?
What usually helps you feel a bit better when you're struggling?
Would you like to explore this feeling a bit more?
What would support look like for you right now?
How has this been affecting your daily life?
What's been the hardest part about all of this?
Are there any moments when you feel a little relief?
What would you like to focus on in our conversation?
coping_suggestions: Taking some slow, deep breaths might help you feel more centered right now.
Sometimes a short walk outside can help shift our mental state.
Writing down your thoughts might help you process what you're feeling.
Reaching out to a trusted friend or family member could provide additional support.
Consider speaking with a mental health professional if these feelings continue.
Gentle movement like stretching might help release some physical tension.
Listening to calming music or sounds from nature can be soothing.
Practicing mindfulness or meditation, even for just a few minutes, might help.
Engaging in a creative activity might provide a healthy outlet for your emotions.
Establishing a regular sleep routine can significantly impact how you feel.
crisis_responses: I'm really concerned about what you're sharing. Please reach out to a crisis hotline at 988 or go to your nearest emergency room.
Your safety is the most important thing right now. Please contact emergency services or call 988 for immediate support.
I want you to know that you matter and help is available. Please call 988 or text HOME to 741741 right now.
These thoughts are very serious. Please don't wait - call 988 or go to an emergency room immediately.
